div1.p: Union Provost Marshal George Eyster, stationed at Chambersburg, writes in June, 1863, to Provost Marshal General J. B. Fry concerning efforts to enforce the draft in Bedford County. Eyster reports that attempts to procure troops from Carlisle Barracks to enforce enrollment failed, and that he is going ahead in attempting to secure citizen guards, sheriffs and prominent men to prevent open and covert resistance to the authority of military enrollers. He also describes some of the violent actions of the resisters.

Although advised by the commandant at Carlisle on the 8th instant that a cavalry force of sixty men could be spared for service in this district, upon my telegraphing yesterday that the detachment should proceed to the scene of disturbance I was advised no troops could be spared and referred to the U. S. officer in command at Harper's Ferry. To order troops from either Baltimore or Harper's Ferry to Bedford County, especially mounted men, would consume probably two days and a half, if not three, and I take it that it is desirable that the enrollment should not be delayed even for that length of time to await the arrival of a military force. I have consequently directed my deputy to require all enrollers inclined to desist to proceed, and authorized him to call upon citizens for a posse comitatus to protect them at their work and aid in arresting persons who have resisted and assisted to resistance of the enrollment. He is instructed to report to me the names of such citizens as are called upon and refuse to give their services. I have called into requisition the assistance of the sheriff in that county, and have asked prominent gentlemen to aid by their counsel and influence in the execution of the order.

You have been advised that the resistance takes the shape of intimidation by secret incendiarism and attempted assassination, If the effort to procure citizen guards fails, which is not improbable, you will please advise me from what quarter to order troops.

closer.signed:
GEO. EYSTER,
Provost-Marshal Sixteenth District of Pennsylvania.
